revised_title: William Lawrence Bragg: A Pioneer in X-ray Crystallography
tldr: William Lawrence Bragg, a British physicist, made significant contributions to the field of X-ray crystallography. His work, along with his father, led to the development of a method that revealed the arrangement of atoms in various materials, from simple salts to the complex molecules of living cells. Bragg's life and achievements are celebrated as a crucial part of the history of science.
